front.head: WRITTEN THE MORNING AFTER ANNA MATILDA's RETURN FROM A FRIEND's HOUSE, Close on the verge of WINDSOR FOREST.

lg.l: HAVE I then left you, sweet Hygeian bowers —
Why are ye vanish'd, dear inviting shades?
Why ceas'd, the cheering music of your glades?
Not which on the surging aether floats,
Or trembles in the linnet's gurgling notes; —
But that which gives you polish'd mind,
Her sense reflective, and her taste refin'd;
When midst their haunts they see her graceful move;
which adorns the clearest, strongest sense,
And clothes in lightest dress, the thought intense.
